file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 55-32-02-04 - VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and apply the VOR-antenna polyurethane film. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - ALL 55-32-02-000-801-A REMOVAL VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - ALL 55-32-02-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 55-32-02 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 55-32-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the VOR-antenna polyurethane film. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 325 Vertical stabilizer C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Spatula To remove the old film 1 available E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Vertical stabilizer H. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Prepare the new film with the old film as a template. Mark the contour to cut the excess material of the new film to the correct size. Refer to steps A and B. CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU REMOVE THE OLD FILM TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE ANTENNA SURFACE. (2) Remove the old polyurethane film. For this, use a spatula and pull the film. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 55-32-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the VOR-antenna polyurethane film. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 55-32-02-000-801-A/400 VOR-ANTENNA POLYURETHANE FILM - REMOVAL IPC 11-21-05 EXTERIOR DECAL, CORROSION PROTECTION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 325 Vertical stabilizer D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To squeegee unapplied film and eliminate Spatula 1 available air bubbles F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 21-012 Neutral Liquid Detergent AR FED. SPEC. TT-I-735 Isopropyl Alcohol AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Polyurethane film IPC 11-21-05 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Vertical stabilizer EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-32-02 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Fully mix neutral liquid detergent with isopropyl alcohol and water. The solution must contain approximately 2.5% of liquid detergent, 24.5% of isopropyl alcohol, and 73% of water. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Use the old film as a reference to cut the new film to the appropriate size. Refer to steps A and B (AMM TASK 55-32-02-000-801-A/400). (2) Clean the antenna surface and the polyurethane film with a cloth wet with isopropyl alcohol. CAUTION: DO NOT PERMIT THE ADHESIVE SIDE OF THE FILM TO BE TOUCHED TO PREVENT FINGERPRINTS AND LOSS OF ADHESIVENESS. (3) Separate the liner from the film and spray the detergent solution on the adhesive surface at the same time. Refer to step C. (4) Wet the antenna surface with detergent solution. (5) Align the film and press on edge to surface with fingers. Refer to step D. CAUTION:IF AIR BUBBLE OCCURS, DO NOT MAKE A HOLE IN THE FILM TO ELIMINATE THE AIR BUBBLE. (6) Squeeze the water out from the antenna with the spatula. Refer to step E. NOTE: If an air bubble occurs, pull the film back up until you get to the location of the air bubble, spray with detergent solution, and apply the film again. (7) After one hour, the VOR antenna with the film is ready for service. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-32-02 Page 5 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
